description:
This module is an introduction to screen writing,

covering the skills and techniques needed to

create an effective screenplay. Students will

explore and analyse ideas, formats, story,

characterisation, structure, conflict, plot, scene,

atmosphere, dialogue, visual style, subtext,

rhythm and pace. Students will also be

encouraged to develop professional writing

habits. The module will have both an analytical

and a creative component. Students will both

interpret screenwriting techniques and apply

them to their own short screenplays. Examples

from a wide variety of genres in world cinema

will be studied and comparisons will be made

between the written screenplay and the final

film.
title: Introduction to Screenwriting
prerequisite:
EL1101E or EN1101E or TS1101E or GEK1011 or GEK1000 or GEM1003. This
module is selective, and enrolment is by application.
